intro.heading: Course Introduction
intro.description: Welcome to the React tutorial! This comprehensive course is tailored for beginners and will take you through the fundamentals of React, a widely-used JavaScript library for building user interfaces. You will learn about components, props, state management, hooks, context API, and routing. Each lesson is filled with practical examples, hands-on projects, and clear explanations to help you understand the core concepts of React development. By the end of this course, you will have the skills and confidence to create your own dynamic web applications using React. Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to refresh your knowledge, this tutorial is the perfect starting point for your React journey!

Prerequisites.heading: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.description: Before starting this course, it is recommended that you have a basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Familiarity with modern JavaScript features like ES6 syntax will be beneficial.

React_Overview.heading: Overview of React
React_Overview.description: React is a powerful library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create large web applications that can change data, without reloading the page. Its component-based architecture promotes reusability and efficient UI development.

Development_Environment.heading: Setting Up Your Development Environment
Development_Environment.description: To get started with React, you'll need to set up your development environment. This includes installing Node.js, npm, and create-react-app, which will help you bootstrap a new React application quickly.

React_App.heading: Creating Your First React App
React_App.description: In this section, we will guide you through the steps of creating your first React application using create-react-app. You'll learn how to structure your project and understand the files generated by the tool.

Project_Structure.heading: Understanding Project Structure
Project_Structure.description: A well-organized project structure is crucial for scaling your React applications. We will explore the typical folder structure, the role of each folder, and best practices for organizing your components.

React_Component.heading: Working with React Components
React_Component.description: Components are the building blocks of any React application. You will learn how to create functional and class components, manage their state and props, and understand component lifecycle methods.

React_Works.heading: How React Works
React_Works.description: Understanding how React works under the hood will help you make better decisions while building applications. We will delve into concepts like the virtual DOM, reconciliation, and how React updates the UI efficiently.
